newsitem.title: GERMANY: Commerzbank 9-mo oper profit up 36.9 pct.
newsitem.headline: Commerzbank 9-mo oper profit up 36.9 pct.

text.p: (in millions of marks unless otherwise stated)
Group oper profit after provisions 1,672 vs 1,221
Group net bad debt provisions 658 vs 562
NOTE - Full name of the German bank is Commerzbank AG.

Results compare with the first nine months of 1995. The operating profit figure is below analysts's forecast for the operating profit, which had averaged 1.8 billion marks and ranged from 1.71 billion marks to 1.92 billion. Commerzbank said that given an expected tax ratio of around 40 percent, the after-tax profit should be roughly one billion marks, which translates into a return-on-equity of just over 11 percent after tax, and 18.7 percent before tax. Bank gave no year-ago for after-tax profit.
Balance of other op. income/expenses +23 vs +12
NOTE - Balance sheet total, business volume and lending volume compare September 30 levels with December 31, 1995.
